text:
314 architecture studio envisions h77 house in voula, athens 
sitting at the foot of the imittos mountain in voula, a southern suburb of athens, greece , h77 house by 314 architecture studio is a private four story residential building. thanks to its strategic position towards the sea and upperlands, this 300 sq. m. house is designed as an extroverted residence with adaptable features. 
south view: h77 house sits at the foot of the imittos mountain in voula, athens 

314 architecture studio ’s design is a result of certain plot specification, as well as looking into the traditional japanese origami craft. hence, the triangulated architecture sits in accordance to the natural surrounding — especially the rocky terrain which in some occasions is flattened and used as a terrace while in others becomes part of the building as a structural feature. t he uppermost storey located inside the roof contains the master suite; middle levels include living rooms and secondary bedrooms while the lowest level includes secondary rooms and a parking area. 
the roof of the residence borrows techniques from the japanese art of origami 

h77 house’s basic characteristic is its large windows covering all façades and protected by an innovative system of movable aluminum curtains that enhance the bioclimatic quality of the house. these curtains are programmed through an electrical system in order to optimize natural light and ventilation during the day, depending on the hour and the season of the year.
